ColumnDescription: Identifier
A numerical code categorizing the broad structural type of the item.
The designated usage category for the area where the item is located.
The length in linear units of the item's frontage on a street.
The total area of the land associated with the item measured in square units.
The type of road providing access to the item's location.
The type of alley access available to the item's location (if any).
The general geometric shape of the land parcel.
A description of the land's levelness or slope.
The types of utility services available at the item's location.
Specific configurations or features of the land parcel.
The degree of inclination of the land.
Geographic sub-regions or zones within a larger area.
Indicates the item's proximity to a major road or transportation route.
Indicates proximity to a second major road or route if applicable.
The specific architectural classification of the structure.
The architectural style of the structure.
A rating of the overall quality of materials used in the item's construction.
A general assessment of the item's current state of repair and upkeep.
The year in which the item was originally built.
The year of a significant remodel or addition to the item.
The style or design of the roof.
The primary material used in the roof's construction.
The dominant material covering the exterior of the item.
A secondary exterior covering material if present.
The type of decorative masonry work used on the item's exterior.
The area covered by masonry work measured in square units.
The quality of the materials used for the exterior cladding.
The current state of the exterior cladding.
The type of foundation supporting the item's structure.
A classification of the basement's height relative to ground level.
The general condition of the basement space.
Describes whether the basement has walkout access or is at garden level.
The quality of finish in the main finished area of the basement.
The size of the main finished area in the basement measured in square units.
The quality of finish in a second finished area of the basement (if applicable).
The size of a second finished area in the basement measured in square units.
The size of the unfinished portion of the basement measured in square units.
The total area of the basement space including finished and unfinished areas measured in square units.
The system used for heating the item.
The quality and condition of the heating system.
Indicates whether the item has central air conditioning.
The type of electrical system installed.Interior Features
The area of the ground floor measured in square units.
The area of the upper floor(s) measured in square units.
Area of the item finished to a lower standard measured in square units.
The total living space above ground level measured in square units.
The number of full bathrooms in the basement.
The number of half bathrooms in the basement.
The number of full bathrooms above ground level.
The number of half bathrooms above ground level.
The number of bedrooms in the item.
The number of kitchens in the item.
The quality of the kitchen's finishes and fixtures.
The total number of rooms above ground level excluding bathrooms.
A rating of the item's overall functionality and layout.
The number of fireplaces in the item.
The quality of the fireplace(s).
The location of the garage relative to the item.
The year the garage was built.
The interior finish of the garage.
The number of vehicles the garage can accommodate.
The area of the garage measured in square units.
The area of the garage measured in square units.
The current condition of the garage.
Indicates whether the driveway is paved.
The area of the wood deck measured in square units.
The area of the open porch measured in square units.
The area of the enclosed porch measured in square units.
The area of the three-season porch measured in square units.
The area of the screen porch measured in square units.
The area of the pool measured in square units.
The quality of the pool.
The quality of the fence.
A miscellaneous feature not covered in other categories.
The monetary value of the additional feature.
The month in which the item was sold.
The year in which the item was sold.
The method or type of sale transaction.
The condition of the sale.
The primary metric we aim to predict or analyze for each item in the dataset.
